metadata.feature_description: Process and render Markdown content in wiki articles

steps.expected: Wiki page loads with article list
steps.actual: Wiki page loaded successfully showing 6 existing articles with All Articles/My Articles tabs

steps.expected: Article creation dialog opens with content editor
steps.actual: Create an article dialog opened with Title, Article Type, Content textarea, Tags fields, and Publish/Cancel buttons

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test content editor type (Rich Text vs Markdown)

steps.action: Examine content editor in create article dialog
steps.expected: Content editor should have Markdown mode or formatting toolbar
steps.actual: Content area displays a plain textarea without any Markdown-specific toolbar or mode toggle. Code analysis confirms dnnRedactor (rich text HTML editor) is used, not a Markdown editor

steps.action: Fill form with markdown content and attempt to publish
steps.expected: Article should be created with markdown content
steps.actual: Form validation failed with 'Text is required' errors on Title and Article Type fields despite having valid values. dnnRedactor editor did not initialize properly

issues: Content editor uses dnnRedactor (HTML rich text editor), not a dedicated Markdown editor
Form validation fails with 'Text is required' error even when fields have valid content
dnnRedactor editor does not initialize properly, showing only plain textarea

steps.action: Enter content with wiki-style link syntax [[Test Article Draft]]
steps.expected: Wiki-style link should be processed and converted to clickable link
steps.actual: Unable to publish article to verify link rendering due to form validation failure

steps.action: Attempt to view existing article to verify link processing
steps.expected: Article content should display with wiki links converted to HTML anchor tags
steps.actual: Clicking on existing article link returned 404 error page - articles not accessible via direct URL

issues: Cannot create new article to test wiki link processing due to editor initialization issues
Existing articles return 404 error when accessed via direct URL links

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test standard Markdown syntax (headers, lists, bold, italic)

steps.action: Review MarkdownProcessor.cs code to understand Markdown support
steps.expected: Code should process standard Markdown syntax (headers, lists, bold, etc.)
steps.actual: Code analysis revealed MarkdownProcessor only handles wiki-style internal links [[Subject]] and [[Title|Subject]]. It does NOT process standard Markdown syntax (# headers, ** bold, * italic, - lists, ``` code blocks, tables)

issues: Standard Markdown syntax (headers, lists, bold, italic, code blocks, tables) is NOT supported
The 'MarkdownProcessor' class only processes wiki-style internal link syntax [[...]], not actual Markdown

observations: The 'Markdown Support' feature name is misleading - the MarkdownProcessor class only handles wiki-style internal links ([[Subject]] and [[Title|Subject]]) rather than standard Markdown syntax
Code analysis of MarkdownProcessor.cs (line 40-69) shows it uses regex to convert [[Subject]] to HTML anchor tags linking to other wiki articles
The content editor uses dnnRedactor, a rich text HTML editor, not a Markdown editor with preview
No UI toggle exists to switch between HTML and Markdown editing modes
Standard Markdown elements (headers #, bold **, italic *, lists -, code blocks ```, tables) are NOT processed by any component
The dnnRedactor editor failed to initialize properly during testing, showing only a plain textarea
Form validation incorrectly reports 'Text is required' even when fields have content - this appears to be related to the editor initialization issue
Direct article URLs return 404 errors, suggesting articles may require specific query parameters (contentItemId) for access
